text:
We have a problem with using JMeter, because some of our pages are behind proxy
and some of them not. It would be good if we can set the same properties for
proxy as it is in browsers (url of proxy + authentization + No proxy for)
creator: lubos.vrba@seznam.cz
sebb@apache.org
text:
Version 2.2.1 has not been released - I assume you meant 2.1.1

See:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/guide/net/properties.html

Just define "http.nonProxyHosts" as a Java System property; this should work 
for the default HTTP implementation. 

Please update this issue with the results.

I'll see about adding this for the Apache HttpClient version.

Added a new option -N to Jmeter - this sets the nonProxyHosts system property 
for the default implementation.

Also updated the HttpClient implementation to omit the proxy if the host 
matches the nonProxyHosts list.
creator: sebb@apache.org
